title.rendered: New Dryer or Dryer Vent Cleaning: Which Will Fix My Dryer Problem?

content.rendered:
Over time, dryer vents become clogged with lint and dirt. If you don’t clean them out regularly, this can lead to longer drying times. The dryer will need to work harder to function properly, causing it to overheat.

To top it off, lint is highly flammable. Combined with overheating, it can increase the risk of a house fire.

If your dryer isn’t working right or has stopped working, it might be time to clean the vents or replace the whole thing. Only searching “dryer vent cleaner near me” via Google search can tell you what’s needed after assessing your dryer.

3 Warning Signs That It’s Time for Dryer Vent Cleaning Local

If you notice the following signs, it means you only need to get your dryer vents cleaned out by a professional. A replacement may not be necessary in this situation.

The outside of the dryer is hot to the touch

Another common sign is when the exterior of the dryer as well as your clothing are both extremely hot. A well-functioning dryer doesn’t get much hot during a normal cycle. Your clothing is supposed to be a bit warm, but dry and fluffy as the cycle ends.

When the clothes are abnormally hot and also seem damp after the drying cycle, it means there is an issue with your dryer vents.

Keep in mind that running the dryer through an extra cycle is not a solution in this situation. If you do that, you will cause the heating parts to burn out which can lead the lint buildup to catch fire.

It takes more than 1 normal cycle to dry your clothing

Does your clothing take 2-3 times the usual time to dry completely? If yes, then it could mean that lint buildup may be clogging the vents.

Normally, dry times are around 30-45 minutes. Any longer than that means lint might be preventing your clothes from receiving dry air. This will also put a huge pressure on the dryer, causing it to overheat.

If left unchecked, this can damage the heating element, forcing you to spend a lot of money on repairs or a brand-new dryer.

A dryer that takes longer to run also consumes a lot of extra energy and can significantly increase your energy bills.

You notice a burning smell when running the dryer

Do you smell a burning odor when the dryer is running? It means lint has accumulated in the vent as well as the other important parts of the dryer like the lint trap, exhaust tube, and drum casting.

As soon as you notice the burning smell, shut the dryer off right away and call a dryer vent cleaner near me.

If you notice any of these issues, you may need to call in professional dryer vent technicians. And if your dryer is more than ten years old and you have already gotten it repaired several times in the past, it might be time to buy a new one. 

Dryer Not Working? Call Dryer Vent Cleaner Near Me

At United Home Services, we have over 20 years of experience in cleaning, repairing, and installing dryer vents. Our licensed and trained technicians can assess your dryer to determine whether you need to replace it or a thorough cleaning will do the job. Call us today toll-free at 800-399-4248 or use our online contact form to get in touch with us!
